summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNED A 1991 FORD RANGER. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED WHEN IT CAUGHT ON FIRE. THE FIRE DEPARTMENT WAS NOTIFIED AND NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED AT THE SCENE. THE VEHICLE WAS DESTROYED. THE DEALER WAS NOT NOTIFIED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED. THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGES WERE 150,000.   UPDATED 8/23/12 *CN

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 FORD RANGER.  THE CONTACT NOTICED THAT THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE OF THE VEHICLE HAD DROPPED APPROXIMATELY FIVE INCHES FROM THE REGULAR POSITION AND THE FRONT FENDER WAS COVERING THE TOP OF THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE TIRE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT TAKEN TO A DEALER FOR DIAGNOSTICS. AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC INSPECTED THE VEHICLE AND NOTICED THAT THE PASSENGER SIDE COIL SPRING MOUNT WAS CORRODED AND NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE CONTACT STATED THAT A LOCAL AUTO SHOP WAS CONTACTED AND ADVISED THAT THE PART WAS NO LONGER AVAILABLE.  THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 65,000.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 FORD RANGER.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE FUEL TANK STRAP BECAME CORRODED AND WAS PARTIALLY FRACTURED FROM THE VEHICLE. THE CONTACT WAS CONCERNED THAT IT WOULD CAUSE THE FUEL TANK TO DETACH. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN AUTHORIZED DEALER WHO STATED THAT THE STRAP WOULD NEED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE CONTACT CALLED THE MANUFACTURER WHO ADVISED THAT THERE WERE NO RELATED RECALLS TO THE FAILURE AND PROVIDED NO FURTHER ASSISTANCE. THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 142,800 AND THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 100,000.

THE FRAME HAS HORRIBLE CORROSION.  ALL THE SPRING HANGERS ARE WERE FAILING BAD.  I DON'T EVEN THINK IT CAN BE WELDED BECAUSE IT IS RUSTED FROM ONE END TO ANOTHER.  FORD REALLY MESSED THIS ONE UP.  AND WHY DO ALL THE FUEL GAUGES QUIT WORKING?  *TR

PEELING FACTORY PAINT PRIMARILY ON TOP SURFACES..I.E. HOOD, CAB ROOF, COWLING.  I HAVE OWNED TRUCK SINCE 12/8/99 AND HAS HAD PROBLEM SINCE,IT HAS LOST NEARLY ALL PAINT ON ROOF , HOOD HAS ABOUT 1/3 LEFT. PRIMARILY LIFTS/PEELS WHEN WASHED OR WHEN LEFT OUT IN RAIN. HAS HAD BITS PEEL BACK AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS. MAINLY OCCURS THOUGH WITH WASHING.  HAVE INQUIRED WITH DEALERS  TO NO AVAIL. WAS TOLD BY ONE THAT THERE WAS A RECALL BUT THAT THE PERIOD FOR REPAIR OF CONDITION HAD PASSED. I HAVE NOT RECEIVED NOR HEARD ANYTHING FROM MFR REGARDING THIS ISSUE WHATSOEVER. *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1991 FORD RANGER.  WHILE DRIVING 5 MPH WITH THE DEFROSTER ACTIVATED, THE VEHICLE BEGAN TO SMOKE.  THE CONTACT PULLED THE VEHICLE OVER AND NOTICED FLAMES UNDER THE HOOD.  THE FIRE DEPARTMENT WAS CALLED AND STATED THAT THERE WAS A FAULTY WIRE UNDER THE HOOD THAT CAUSED THE FIRE.  PRIOR TO THE FAILURE, THE CLUTCH AND POWER STEERING WERE REPAIRED AND THE GAS LINE WAS CLEANED.  THE VEHICLE HAS NOT BEEN TAKEN TO A DEALER OR MECHANIC.  A POLICE REPORT WAS FILED.   THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 100,000.   UPDATED 062909  *BF  UPDATED 07/01/09
THE CONSUMER MADE CONTACT WITH THE MANUFACTURE FOR THE FRONT END SUSPENSION PART THAT WAS DISCONTINUED.  *JB

BOTH MIRRORS FOLDED UP AGAINST THE VEHICLE WHEN DRIVING.  DRIVER'S SIDE WAS REPLACED THREE TIMES, AND THE PASSENGER'S SIDE TWICE.  HOWEVER, DRIVER'S SIDE MIRROR MALFUNCTIONED AGAIN.  *AK    TRUCK IS IN GARAGE FROM 11-1 TOMAY 1. AND I STIKK ONLY GET1 YEAR TO 18 MONTHS PER MIRROR.  I REALIZE  THE VEHICLE IS 13 YEARS OLD AND REDESIGNING THE MIRROR IS NOT ANOPTION. HOWEVER, FORD  MOTOR CORP SURELY COULD DO SOMETHING ABOUT THE PRICE! RETAIL IS CLOSRE TO $7500 PER PIECE. I KNOW REDESIGNING IS OUT OF QUESTION, BUT FOR THOSE  OF US THAT  INTEND ON KEEPING OUR VEHICLES,  THE COMPANY COULD REDUCE THE PRICE.  *AK

CONSUMER STATES THAT HIS MOTOR MOUNTS ARE RUSTING RIGHT OUT FROM THE FRAME.  HE STATES HE HAS NEVER SEEN ANYTHING LIKE IT.  HE STATES HE HAS NOT SEEN A RECALL FOR THIS PROBLEM, BUT HE DOES NOT THINK THIS IS NORMAL.   *NM

RIGHT FRONT SPRING BRACKET RUSTED THROUGH ALLOWING BODY TO DROP ONTO FRONT TIRE, AND I NOTICED THERE ARE A LOT OF COMPLAINTS ON THIS ISSUE AND WAS WANTING TO KNOW IS FORD GOING TO FIX THIS PROBLEM OR ARE WE THE PUBLIC GOING TO GET STUCK WITH THIS PROBLEM ?  *JB
THE VEHICLE WAS SITTING OUT SIDE WHEN THE BATTERY EXPLODED.   THE VEHICLE CAUGHT ON FIRE AS A RESULT.  *JG  *JB

TRAVELING N ON I-95 ON 12/20/2002 AT APPROX 4 P.M. RIGHT FRONT TIRE TREAD SEPARATED, BEAT AND DAMAGED FENDER; HOWEVER, TIRE MAINTAINED SAME PRESSURE. 1 WAS ASSISTED BY OFFICER K.R. MEARES OF TOBESON COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPT,TEL 910-671-3100.   DIMSII IVOQ ENTRY POSTED AFTER 12/12/02 CUT-OVER TO ARTEMIS------770783.   *AK    *NLM

WHILE PARKED, THE VEHICLE CAUGHT FIRE DUE TO A FAILED IGNITION SWITCH,  MANUFACTURER INFORMED CONSUMER THAT THE FAILED PART WAS NOT WORTHY OF ANY TYPE OF ASSISTANCE TO COMPENSATE FOR A VEHICLE DESTROYED BY FIRE. PH.  CONSUMER WAS INJURED WHILE TRYING TO PUT THE FIRE OUT. *JB

WHILE DRIVING VEHICLE 70MPH, FELT THE FRONT STARTING TO VIBRATE. HAD PULLED OVER AND CHECKED TIRES. THE RIGHT FRONT TIRE HAD A LARGE BUBBLE. THE TREAD WAS STARTING TO SEPARATE. WENT TO AN INDEPENDENT TIRE DEALER AND THE SPARE TIRE REPLACED THE BLOWN TIRE.  NOT ORIGINAL TIRES. FIRESTONE FR 480 P215/70R14 TS

CONSUMER STATED THAT A BATTERY EXPLODED, AND VEHICLE CAUGHT FIRE.   CONSUMER STATES THIS WAS VERY DANGEROUS.  MANUFACTURE OF BATTERY IS JOHNSON CONTROLS INC. /SEAR DIE HARD.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.   MR

BOTH MIRRORS HAVE BEEN REPLACED MORE THAN ONE TIME BECAUSE THEY DO NOT STAY POSITIONED.  DEALER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED. NLM  CONSUMER STATED THAT WHEN THE MIRRORS DO NOT STAY IN POSITIONED DRIVERS HAVE NO VIEW OF REAR LANES, THE MIRRORS FOLD BACK AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS. *YH
TIRES WERE PURCHASE AT COSTCO WHOLESALE. THESE TIRES SEEM TO HAVE A WEAKER SIDEWALL THAN THE OTHERS TIRES THEY SALE. POSSIBLY A SAFETY HAZARD. THESE TIRES WERE WARRANTED TO 80,000 MILES.        S.*AK
CONSUMER STATED THAT THE RIGHT FRONT SHOCK MOUNT COMPLETELY RUSTED. *YH
FIREWALL SEPARATING AND CRACKING AT CLUTCH MASTER CYLINDER. *AK

RIGHT FRONT SHOCK TOWER COLLAPSED ON VEHICLE WHICH CAME APART FROM FRAME. DEALER CONTACTED. *AK. CONSUMER STATES THE RIGHT FRONT SUSPENSION HOUSING CORRODED AND FAILED, CONSUMER STATES PART MAY NOT HAVE BEEN PROPERLY HEAT TREATED PRIOR TO INSTALLATION.*JB

THE COMPONENT HAD CORRODED AND FAILED.  REPAIR SHOP SAID THEY HAD NEVER SEEN THIS BEFORE.  SUGGESTED THAT THE PART MAY NOT HAVE BEEN PROPERLY TREATED PRIOR TO INSTALATION.  LEFT SIDE MATCHING COMPONENT SHOWES NO CORROSION.  WAS MAKING A LEFT TURN WHEN THE PART MADE A SNAPPING SOUND AND THE RIGHT FRONT OF THE TRUCK DROPPED RUBBING THE TIRE.*AK

CONSUMER  PURCHASED MANUAL LOCKING HUBS FROM  DEALERSHIP TO REPLACE  AUTOMATIC LOCKING HUBS THAT WERE ORIGINAL EQUIPMENT FOR  VEHICLE.  AFTER  MANUAL LOCKING HUBS WERE INSTALLED ON  FRONT WHEELS  VEHICLE WAS TAKEN FOR A TEST DRIVE.  AFTER DRIVING FOR FIVE MILES AT A SPEED OF 10 TO 15 MPH,  HOUSING FOR RIGHT/FRONT HUB CRACKED AND DISCONNECTED.    PLEASE PROVIDE ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION / DOCUMENTATION.*AK

WE BOUGHT THIS TIRES IN NOVEMBER AT ROBERTSON TIRES IN TULSA, OK.  I WAS DRIVING DOWN THE ROAD AND THE TIRE JUST SEPARATED FROM THE RIM.    I TOOK PICTURES OF THE TIRE AND WENT TO SEE IF THEY WOULD FIX IT AND THEY SAID THAT THEY WOULD HAVE TO CHARGE ME $40 TO REPLACE THAT TIRE.  THEY COULDN'T CHANGE ALL THE TIRES BECAUSE THEY DIDN'T COME WITH THE TRUCK. MY MOM HAD THE SAME PROBLEM WITH WILD COUNTRY TIRES AND FIRESTONE ENDED UP REPLACING ALL 4.  THIS IS THE SECOND TIME IN MY LIFE THAT I HAVE SEEN A TIRE SEPARATE LIKE THAT AND WAS WONDERING IF THERE WAS ANYTHING I CAN DO TO GET ALL 4 REPLACED OR DO I HAVE TO GO AHEAD AND PAY TO GET THAT ONE FIXED AND PRAY THAT THE OTHERS DON'T SEPERATE LIKE THAT ONE?  THE TIRE IS A FIREHAWK SS20 RWL P215/70R14.  I AM SCARED TO DRIVE ON THESE TIRES.  I HAVE 2 KIDS THAT RIDE AROUND IN THE VEHICLE WITH ME AND WHAT HAPPENS IF ANYMORE BLOW AND IS FATAL? I HAVE THE RECEIPT FOR THE TIRES AND PICTURES OF IT AND NEED TO KNOW WHAT TO DO.  I WILL WAIT TO DO ANYTHING MORE UNTIL I HEAR FROM YOU.  I WILL BE CALLING THE CORPORATE OFFICE OF ROBERTSON TIRE AND FIRESTONE.  ANY INFORMATION THAT YOU CAN GIVE ME OR HELP ME WITH WOULD BE GREATLY APPRECIATED.   SINCERELY, TAMMY. *AK (DOT NUMBER: HYHYF21529  TIRESIZE: P215/70R14)
CONSUMER IS HAVING PROBLEMS WITH A DEFECTIVE IGNITION SWITCH THAT IS POSSIBLY CAUSING VEHICLE TO STALL.  *TT

CONSUMER STATES HE WAS UNABLE TO STOP VEHICLE BECAUSE OF A HIGHLY CORRODED RUPTURED BRAKE LINE, VEHICLE REAR ENDED ANOTHER VEHICLE AND CONSUMERS VEHICLE WAS DEEMED TOTALED, CONSUMER IS SEEKING REIMBURSEMENT FROM MANUFACTURER FOR THE REPAIRS OF THE BRAKES.*YH
SHIFT LEVER WAS PLACED IN PARK POSITION AND THE TRANSMISSION REMAINED IN THE REVERSE GEAR.  I BELEIVE THAT THIS IS AN FMVSS VIOLATION OF THE SHIFT /INDICATION SYSTEM.*AK
WHILE DRIVING  WOULD HEAR NOISE COMING FROM  RIGHT FRONT.  HAD TAKEN VEHICLE TO DEALER,  AND THEY SAID THAT NOISE  WAS COMING FROM HOUSING ASSEMBLY.*AK
BRAKE LINE WAS CORRODED, AND WHEN PRESSURE WAS APPLIED, IT BLEWOUT BRAKE LINE.  AN ACCIDENT OCCURRED BECAUSE OF THIS PROBLEM.  *AK  *JB
PLASTIC NYLON BUSHING ON  FRONT RADIAL ARM CRACKED, CAUSING  FRONT SUSPENSION TO BECOME LOOSE.  DEALER HAS BEEN CONTACTED.*AK
THE BODY OF THE TRUCK IS BENDING AND CRACKING CAUSING THE FRONT WINDSHIELD ABOVE THE STEERING WHEEL TO LEAK WHEN IT RAINS.  NLM
VAPOR SYSTEM FAILED INSPECTION.  DEALER / MANUFACTURER WERE NOT NOTIFIED AT THIS TIME. PLEASE  PROVIDE ANY FURTHER DETAILS ON THIS MATTER.  *AK
BOTH OUTSIDE MIRRORS FAILED FOR  3RD TIME. THEY FOLD IN WHILE DRIVING, AND CONSUMER IS UNABLE TO SEE TRAFFIC.  *AK
AT HIGHWAY SPEED  THROTLE STUCK AT FULL.SCARED THE SH__!   OUT OF ME . WAS GOING OVER 90 MPH BEFORE GETTING IT PULLED OVER.   HELP !*AK
THERE IS  A METAL WALL BETWEEN  BRAKE PEDA,  GAS PEDAL WITH  ENGINE, MAKING IT  DIFFICULT TO DRIVE VEHICLE.  CONSUMER WILL ADD MORE INFORMATION.  *AK
WHEEL BEARINGS FAILED.  NLM

A COMPLETE TREAD SEPARATION. I TYPED ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, BUT YOUR PAGE APPARENTLY WON'T LET ME PASTE IN THIS SPACE AND I'M TOO LAZY TO TYPE IT ALL AGAIN. CALL ME IF YOU WANT TO KNOW MORE.  *AK (DOT NUMBER: W2HYINK330  TIRESIZE: P215/70R14)
SPRING HOUSING CORRODED, CONSUMER DISCOVERED PROBLEM BEFORE COMPLETE FAILURE OCCURED. *ET

WHILE DRIVING ABOUT 75-80 MH DRIVER  NOTICED A TIRE DEFECT. TIRE TREAD BROKE, CAUSING DRIVER TO LOSE  BRAKES, AND  VEHICLE FLIPPED OVER TWICE.  DRIVER WAS CARRYING A CHILD AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT.*AK
PE00 020; CONSUMER WAS INSPECTING  TIRES AND  NOTICED THAT FRONT TWO TIRES' TREAD WAS BEGINNING TO PEEL.  FIRESTONE,#FR480, P2215/R14  HE HAS REPLACED THE TIRES, THERE WERE NO INJURIES.*AK
NO PSNGRS, NO INJURIES. NI ADVISED TIRE WHICH SHREDDED WAS A FIRESTONE TIRE BUT NOT THE KIND WHICH THE COMPANY HAS RECENTLY RECALLED. (CLAIM# 14-1301-939) *MW

I NOTICED I DID NOT HAVE PASSING GEAR SO I DEPRESSED THE ACCELERATOR AND COULD NOT STOP THE VEHICLE. CONSIDERING THAT YOU HAVE HAD REPORTS ON THIS PROBLEM SINCE 1990 (RE:ODI ID:402614) AND CONSIDERING THAT I COULD HAVE LOST CONTROL OF MY VEHICLE AND KILLED SOMEONE AND MYSELF, I THINK FORD SHOULD ISSUE A RECALL AND COMPENSTE ME FOR THE NEW THROTTLE BOX I HAD INSTALLED  (295.56). BY THE WAY, THE MECHANIC WHO TESTED MY TRUCK SAID HE THOUGHT HE WAS GOING TO DIE BECAUSE HE HAD A HARD TIME STOPPING THE TRUCK EVEN AFTER BEING BRIEFED ABOUT THE PROBLEM.*AK
OUTSIDE REARVIEW MIRRORS ON BOTH SIDE DO NOT HOLD ITS POSITION AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS, CAUSING POOR TO NO VISIBILITY. FORD  IS NOT ABLE TO REMEDY THE DEFECT.*AK

TIRE SEPERATING FROM STEEL BELT. STILL HAVE ONE TIRE AND I WILL SHIP IT ON REQUEST. FIRESTONE NEEDS TO BRODEN TIS RECALL. THEY HAVE MADE BAD TIRES THAT I KNOW OF FOR 20 YEARS!( DOT NUMBER: W2HYFR5 TIRE SIZE: 215/70/R15 )

NOTICED RUST FELL OFF NEAR FRONT RIGHT TIRE. HAD MECHANIC AT WORK CHECK HE SAID THAT IT IS READY TO BREAK AND THE TRUCK IS NOT SAFE TO DRIVE. I HAVE NOT CONTACTED FORD I LOOKED AT YOUR SITE AND FOUND MANY TRUCKS WITH SAME PROBLEM.NOT SURE WHAT TO DO SINCE IT IS OBVIOUSLY A PROBLEM THAT NOT ONLY MY TRUCK HAD.  I FEEL FORD SHOULD BE REPLACING THEM. MY TRUCK ALSO HAS LOW MILAGE.

I RECENTLY PURCHASED A 1991 RANGER PICKUP USED.  SINCE THE PURCHASE I HAVE DRIVEN THE VEHICLE ABOUT 1500 MILES.  I NOTICED WHILE INSTALLING NEW SHOCK ABSORBERS THAT THE SPRING MOUNT (TOP BRACKET) WAS RUSTED.  WITHIN 500 MILES OF THE INSTALLATION THE BRACKET HAS STARTED TO SEPERATE FROM THE FRAME AND THE RIGHT FRONT CORNER OF THE TRUCK WAS NOTICABLLY LOWER.  I WENT TO A FORD DEALER AND WAS TOLD THE TRUCK WAS DANGEROUS TO DRIVE AND THAT THE SPRING COULD BE EJECTED FROM ITS POSITION CAUSING A ACCIDENT.  I WAS ALSO TOLD OF ANOTHER RANGER 1993 WITH THE SAME CONDITION.  I WANTED TO INFORM THE NTSA, ONLY BECAUSE I BELIEVE THIS CONDITION IS A FACTORY DEFECT THAT MOST LIKELY WON'T SHOW UP UNTIL THE VEHICLE HAS SOME AGE AND MILES ON IT.  IT COULD BE THE CAUSE OF MANY ACCIDENTS AND INJURIES IF IT IS COMMON TO MANY OF THESE VEHICLES.   THANK YOU

CONSUMER  WAS TRAVELING ABOUT 60MPH ON THE HIGHWAY AND VEHICLE MADE A LOUD BANGING NOISE.  THE WHOLE FRONT OF  VEHICLE WAS ON THE GROUND.   RIGHT FRONT UPPER COIL SPRING  FAILED, AND THE PAINT  THAT WAS ON THE PART HAD CORRODED. *AK

THE HEAD GASKET FAILED IN THE ENGINE. THE REPAIR BILL WAS $627.69. I TALKED TO FORD MOTOR COMPANY'S CUSTOMER SERVICE DEPT. THEY DECLINED TO PAY FOR REPAIR EVEN THOUGH THE FAILURE IS A KNOWN DESIGN DEFECT. *AK

WHILE DRIVING  VEHICLE STALLED UNEXPECTEDLY AND WITHOUT WARNING WHICH COULD HAVE CAUSED A CRASH.  TOOK VEHICLE TO DEALER IN  MARCH 1997, AND DEALER REPLACED SENSORS.   IN MAY 2000,  PROBLEM HAS REOCCURRED.  ABLE TO RESTART  VEHICLE, AND WON'T STALL AFTER  FIRST INCIDENT.   PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.  *AK
THE EXTERIOR MIRRORS FAILED.  NLM

AIR CONDITIONER FAILS INTERMITTENTLY AND HAS BEEN RECHARGED 5 TIMES.  THE COMPRSSOR HAS BEEN REPLACED, THE MAIN PIPING FROM THE CONDENSOR TO THE COMPRESSOR HAS BEEN REPLACED AND THE SYSTEM STILL LOOSES IT'S CHARGE WITHIN 30 DAYS.  NLM
BOTH SIDE-VIEW MIRRORS ARE USELESS, THEY FLOP AGAINST THE VEHICLE AT SPEEDS OF 55MPH AND SOMETIMES EVEN LESS, THEY WILL NOT STAY ADJUSTED AND THEY ARE VERY EXPENSIVE TO REPLACE FROM THE DEALER.

THE SIDE MIRRORS ON THE TRUCK WILL FOLD IN AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS. THE PROBLEM STARTED AFTER I HAD THE TRUCK A YEAR OR SO AND HAS GOTTEN PROGRESSIVELY WORSE. I HAVE TALKED TO SEVERAL OWNERS OF RANGERS WITH THIS STYLE OF MIRROR, AND THEY ALL REPORT THE SAME PROBLEM. I CONTACTED FORD FOR A REPLACEMENT MIRROR AND THEY COULD ONLY OFFER THE SAME TYPE MIRROR. I SEE THIS AS A MAJOR SAFETY ISSUE, AS THE MIRRORS WILL NOT STAY IN ADJUSTMENT. I THINK THE MIRROR STYLE CHANGED IN 1992, BUT WAS USED FOR SEVERAL YEARS PRIOR.  *AK
CLUTCH WAS BAD DUE TO CRACK IN FIREWALL NOT ALLOWING FULL TRAVEL OF MASTER CYLINDER AND PROBLEMS SHIFTING.  TRANSMISSION BEARINGS AND GEARS WORN OUT BEYOND REASONABLE REPAIR.

WHEN PURCHASED  VEHICLE  ABS LIGHTS WERE ON AND STAYED ON.  ALSO, CLUTCH BECAME INOPERABLE. CONTACTED DEALER, AND WAS TOLD THAT THE FIREWALL WAS CRACKED BROKEN, AND NEEDED TO BE REPAIRED.  STILL HAVING PROBLEMS.  *AK
RIGHT FRONT UPPER SPRING MOUNT PREMATURELY RUSTED OUT, CAUSING VEHICLE TO DROP.  CAUSED BY COATING ON PART TRAPPING MOISTURE.  OTHER PARTS MAY ALSO FAIL. *AK
CRACKED CYLINDER HEAD CAUSING ENGINE LEAKAGE. MJS
THE FRAME MOUNTS THAT HOLD THE CAB TO THE TRUCK, RUSTED.  DEALER AND MANUFACTURER HAVE BEEN NOTIFIED.  *AK
NO SUMMARY

FRONT MOUNTS THAT SUPPORT  BODY OF  VEHICLE DROPPED UNTO THE WHEEL, ALMOST CAUSING LOSS OF CONTROL.   *AK
DEFECT CAUSES SHIFING INTO ANY GEAR WHEN STOPPED , REPLACE CLUTCH TWICE, NO IMPROV.

BOTH OF THE PIECES OF THE LOWER DOOR HINGES BROKE OFF AS THE DOOR WAS OPENED.  THIS RESULTS IN AN UNSAFE MANNER IN WHICH TO EXIT AND ENTER THE VEHICLE AS ONE MUST HOLD THE DOOR TO PREVENT IT FROM CLOSING ON BODY PARTS (LEGS ESPECIALLY) IF THE WIND IS BLOWING OR THE VEHICLE IS PARKED ON A HILL.  *AK
ENGINE GASKET BLEW, CAUSING OIL TO LEAK  AND THE OIL PUMP TO STOP.  CAUSE UNKNOWN.  PLEASE GIVE ANY FURTHER DETAILS.  *AK
RQ97015, WHILE IN PARK POSITION AND IN A SLIGHT INCLINE THE VEHICLE HAD A NOISE AND SUDDENLY ACCELERATED UNEXPECTEDLY, CAUSED AN ACCIDENT.  PLEASE PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION AND VIN#.  *AK
VEHICLE HAS A CRACK IN FIREWALL WHICH CAUSES PROBLEMS WHEN SHIFTING GEARS. DEALER NOT AWARE OF PROBLEM. PROBLEM STILL EXISTS. PROVIDE FURTHER INFORMATION.  *AK
THE RIGHT FRONT UPPER SPRING MOUNT LOCATED IN THE LOWER SUSPENSION HAS PREMATURELY RUSTED OUT. DEALER HAS BEEN NOTIFIED.  *AK
CLUTCH CYLINDER LOCATED AT THE BASE OF FIREWALL BROKE THROUGH THE FIREWALL, CAUSING THE GEAR TO BECOME STUCK.  WILL NOT MOVE OUT OF GEAR. THIS CAN RESULT IN  AN ACCIDENT.

THE COOLING FAN FAILED WHILE DRIVING @62MPH ON THE FREEWAY AT AN EVEN SPEED IN O.D. THE BLADE CAME OFF THE FAN DAMAGING THE RADIATOR AND CUTTING COOLING SYSTEM HOSES AND CAUSING MAJOR DAMAGE TO THE HOOD OF THE VEHICLE.  THE AIR CONDITIONG UNIT HAD TO BE REPAIRED AS A HOSE WAS SEVERED AND COMPLETE SYSTEM DRIED (DRYER) AND RESERVICED WITH FREON.

WHILE STATIONARY IN MY 1991 FORD RANGER EXTENDED CAB PICKUP WITH THE SEAT BELT BUCKELED I ENDURED A 50+ MPH REAR END COLLISION.  THE MOMENTUM OF THE COLLISION THREW ME FORWARD AND AS I RECOILED BACK AGAINST THE SEAT, THE SEAT COLLAPSED AND ALLOWED ME TO BE THROWN BACKWARDS WITH SUCH FORCE AS TO BREAK THE REAR WINDOW WITH MY HEAD.

DURING ROUTINE WASHING OF VEHICLE PAINT PEELED OFF CAB. SMALL AMOUNTS  AT FIRST, THEY BECAME LARGER OVER TIME.  SOON, ABOUT 1/2 HALF OF PAINT ON ROOF OF CAB HAD PEELED OFF.  DECIDED TO SEEK REMEDY AT DEALER WHO SAID NOT COVERED, INSURANCE COMPANY SAID IT IS MANUFACTURER PROBLEM AND NOT COVERED. I'VE BEEN PESIMMISTIC EVER SINCE AND RECENTLY THE PRIMER COATING HAS FAILED AND THE ROOF IS NOW BEGINNING TO RUST.

THIS VEHICLE HAS DELAMINATION OF THE CLEARCOAT ON THE HOOD AND THE BED RAILS. THIS IS NOW STARTING TO OCCUR ON THE PASSENGER SIDE DOOR. THIS IS NOT AN ISOLATED INCIDENT AS I HAVE SEEN MANY FORD VEHICLES WITH THE SAME PROBLEM. I BELIEVE THAT THIS IS A MANUFACTURES DEFECT.
OIL PAN GASKET DESINTEGRATES AND PLUGS OIL PUMP.
WHEN BRAKES ARE APPLIED THE DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT BELT BUCKLE DISENGAGES. DEALERS NOTED PROBLEM WAS NORMAL WERE AND TEAR. *AK
WHILE DRIVING THE PARKING BRAKE CABLE RUBBED AGAINST BRAKE LINE,  CAUSING OWNER TO LOSE BRAKE FLUID, AND TOTAL LOSS OF BRAKE POWER.   *AK
GEAR SHIFT KNOB FELL OFF IN DRIVERS HAND WHILE SHIFTING GEARS.
SINCE ABOUT OCTOBER OF 1993, THE OUTSIDE MIRROR ON THE DRIVER'S AND PASSENGER SIDE CONTINUE TO FALL DOWN. THE PROBLEM HAS NOT BEEN CORRECTED.  *AK
WHEEL SEPARATED FROM THE TRUCK RESULTING IN VEHICLE CRASH, THREAD WORN INSIDE NUT CAUSED FASTENER FAILURE.

THE ENTIRE RIGHT FRONT WHEEL ASSEMBLY SEPARATED FROM THE VEHICLE, RESULTING IN A CRASH.  THE SPINDLE NUT, SEALS, AND BEARINGS WERE FACTORY INSTALLED.  THREADS ON THE NUT HAD WORN AWAY, THE NUT CAME OFF THE SPINDLE THREADS.
MEMEBERS AND FRAME CRACKED, ALSO BED OF VEHICLE IS WORN OUT. VEHICLE IS VERY UNSAFE TO DRIVE
